questions.question: What is meant by the term 'stakeholder'? (1-4)

choices.answer: A person who owns a product or organisation
Anyone who has interest in a product or organisation
A person who buys products from an organisation
Person who creates legislation for buying and selling

questions.question: Which legislation governs the act of hacking? (1-4)

choices.answer: The Freedom of Information Act
The Data Protection Act
The Creative Commons License
The Computer Misuse Act

questions.question: What does the Data Protection Act give an individual the right to do? (3-6)

choices.answer: Right to request data about them from a company for no fee
Right to request data about them from a company for a fee
Right to request any data from a company for no fee
Right to request any data from a company for a fee

questions.question: Which legislation governs the act of intellectual property theft? (1-4)

choices.answer: The Copyright, Designs and Patents Act
The Data Protection Act
The Freedom of Information Act
The Computer Misuse Act

questions.question: Who ensures the Data Protection Act requirements are met in an organisation? (6-9)?

choices.answer: The Individual
The Data Controller
The Stakeholder
The Computer Network

questions.question: Which statement is true about the Freedom of Information Act for individuals rights? (3-6)

choices.answer: Right to have personal data corrected if inaccurate
Right to compensation if personal data is stolen
Right to access information held by public authorities
Right to share any intellectual property they have

questions.question: Why would an author obtain a Creative Commons License? (5-9)

choices.answer: To stop the pubic sharing their work
To make sure their work has a patent
To make sure they are able to legally sell their work
To give public the right to share and build on their work

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about open source software? (3-6)

choices.answer: The software cannot be copied, modified or shared
The software can be copied, modified or shared
You normally have to pay for a license to use the software
The software is not available for public use

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false about proprietary software? (3-6)

choices.answer: The software cannot be copied, modified or shared
The software can be copied, modified or shared
You have to pay for a license to use the software
An example of the software is Microsoft Office suite

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false about privacy and the Internet? (6-9)

choices.answer: Comapny's privacy settings must be easy to find and manage
An individual can encrypt their personal data
An individual is free from deformation of their character
Deleted social media data is deleted from all company server

questions.question: A company creates an app using only ASCII characters.  What issue haven't they considered? (4)

choices.answer: Cultural
Legal
Environmental
Moral/Ethical

questions.question: Which of these statements is true? (4)

choices.answer: There are no environmental issues with computing
Only the greenhouse effect is linked to computers
Advance in technology should not worry about the environemnt
Advancing technology can be good and bad for the environment

questions.question: You designed a new app and thought a company was using your idea, which act would stop them? 4

choices.answer: Creative Commons License
Computer Misuse Act
Copyright Designs and Patents Act
Freedom of Information Act

questions.question: If you use social media regularly, what step is recommended to be more secure online? (4)

choices.answer: Always use the same password
Only post non-private data/pictures
Always use a mobile phone for security
Share other people's pictures as much as possible
